column4: anyone know an answer to my update problem? I HAVE done some digging, and found that some routers refer to the internal DHCP as the router's internal IP, which I've found to be true in this router through resolv.conf
who, me?
so, can I please get some help with this? I know you're all doing this on your own time, so no pressure.
I hope the ECN feature in your kernel is closed, and ECN might cause some problem with some kinds of routers.(But in default the option is closed).
how do I check that?
and how do I type a message to a specific person? I'm a newbie when it comes to IRC.
kk
use `sysctl -a | grep ecn'
this is what I get when checking that, http://paste.ubuntu.com/572895/
do I need to use sudo?
it's unnecessary to use sudo
well, I'm getting a lot of "permission denied"s on the command.
according to `http://www.bloke.com/linux/kernel/network.html', the ECN is open in your kernel.
but on my laptop, it has the same value as you have.
hmmm, kk, so what does that mean? it's off?
you can safely ignore that permission denied messages
ok, that's all I get.
I take it that this means that it's turned off?
maybe I use virtualbox or some other application which let the tcp_ecn turned on.
well, I have traced the IP in my resolv.conf file to the  router i'm using.
It's a boolean value, and if you set it to zero, you close that kernel option.
I'll pastebin the contents of my  resolv.conf file
at the beginning of the URL I sent to you, you can use the command line to disable ecn option(and you need sudo that commadline).
Have you try to open `http://extras.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/maverick/' in firefox ?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/572897/  that's my resolv.conf file.
is your machine directly connected to the router with network cable?Or there are some other network devices between your machine and the router?
I've got it connected wirelessly to the router.
I've had a previous fix to that where I change the IP in the resolv.conf file to something, but I can't remember the command to edit it, nor what to change it to,
ok. Can you open the repo by webbrowser(Firefox)?
what's the url?
`http://extras.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/maverick/'
I can get on there.
I believe it has problems downloading the files through update manager.
have you checked the proxy settings in your desktop environment?
let me check
Or the proxy settings in Synaptic.
Okay, how do I check the proxy setting in gnome?
In some circumstance, the router didn't rely dns lookup well, so if you know the DNS settings, you can set it in networkmanager or in the router's setting page.
in synaptic, it says "Direct connection to the internet"
menu`System' -> `Control Center' -> `Network Proxy'
can you do `update' in synaptic now?
no proxy used at all.
trying the update.
http://paste.ubuntu.com/572899/ error after I do a reload in synaptic
so, what might a possible fix be?
this also prevents a cache update in Ubuntu software center.
The file is small, so MTU issue can not affect the update process.
I don't use the extra repo of ubuntu, so I'm not sure about the problem in this repo.
so what can I do about this? like I've said, I've previously been able to update and everything by editing the resolv.conf file
and neiver do I.
have you ever successfully updated this repo?
*neither
not here, but I can at my house.
you mean now you use a different network connection than that you at home?
currently as I'm with relatives.
so, what can I do about this? I'd be okay with just editing my resolv.conf file if I knew  how and to what
because it's worked here in the past.
I had the similiar experiences before, it's mainly due to the ISP or the network connection. You would like me to tell you how to edit the resolv.conf ?
yeah, and what a good IP for the file
if possible.
Google Public DNS, Configure your network settings to use the IP addresses 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4 as your DNS servers
btw, I use the same ISP at home, so I bet this could be their router.
yeah, maybe.
you can read this to configure the dns `http://code.google.com/speed/public-dns/docs/using.html'
bochs, qemu
and the google thing turns me back to the original problem of updating where I can't resolve.
*sigh* guess I'll just wait to get home.... but it's gonna be frustrating with mail.....
have you used the nslookup command to verify the hostname lookup?
the error msg is mainly due to dns error, and sometimes it's hard to resolve this problem. I often refresh serveal times to get all the package list successfully downloaded.
of course, dunno how to make sense of it, but the server IP matches the resolv.conf file I had up.
you mean nslookup reports that the repo servers' ip is 192.168.x.x ?
yes
wait, repo? no, I checked google.
the server http://extras.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/maverick/ has 192.168.x.x
is the server address for that normal?
the server address I get for http://extras.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/maverick/ is 192.168.x.x is this normal?
have you got my messages?
sorry, i left for a few minutes.
ok, well, is the server address for the repo "192.168.x.x" the actual server?
because it perfectly matches the router here.
the address 192.168.x.x is lan address, it sould never be assigned to hosts on internet.
hmmmm, well looks like that's the problem with the update manager, huh?
I think it's DNS problem.
hmmm, so how should I go about fixing this?
the router ip address is 192.168.2.1 ?
yep
and that's the exact same IP i got for the repo,
AND google
You need a network cable to login in the router (if appliable) to see the status of the internet connection.
Sorry
well, I'll ask my mom if I can check that.
You should check the dns settings on router
Does the router have any host blacklist or time access control?
normally, you need a network cable to connect your machine and the router so that you can get the router login page by webbrowser.
